annotation.TEXT: Fun fact: Apparently the PC version swaps Sigma's first and second themes around. I didn't know this at the time of editing this segment, but either way, I prefer the original order of these themes.

Now we move on to one of the things I could really do without in this game: For Sigma's final phase, he has two different forms, both with their own individual health bars. The opportunities you get to damage both of them tend to be rather short (especially if they use specific attacks), and their weakness can be rather unconventional at times. This is mostly due to the "Power Ranger" heads that show up out of nowhere during this fight, which can sometimes help in serving as stepping stones, but can also easily block out your shots or interfere with you hitting Sigma (especially the face form).

Anyways, about Sigma himself...to be completely honest here, Sigma has always been my least favorite fight in nearly every X game. I don't know why, but it seems like there's always a different, unenjoyable factor that drags these fights down. In this game, I actually think his second phase after he loses the cloak is pretty fun to fight (despite some of the oversights with his hitbox). Most of my ire is mainly directed at his final form(s), though.

At this point, I think it's easy to tell that I got fed up with attempting to use Soul Body on him and just switched to the buster (which is probably what I should have done from the beginning). Even if it deals more damage to him by comparison, Soul Body still isn't worth using on this phase simply due to how annoying it is to use effectively.

The larger form's weakness is also incredibly unconventional. Soul Body, while efficient at dealing damage to him, is incredibly annoying to line up properly. Even when using the hover from X's leg armor, it doesn't seem to last long enough to get a decent amount of hits on him. That's also not including the possibility of Sigma spamming his quicker laser move when he shows up, giving you even less of an opportunity to deal damage to him.

From what I've seen, a lot of people seem to prefer taking the bottom path in this section. I'm guessing the reason for this is because the bottom path is somewhat easier, though I personally prefer the top path since it seems to go by a bit faster (provided you rush past the lasers). That, and I find the enemy placement on the bottom to be a bit more annoying.

Double is rather fast but not too difficult, provided you don't use his weakness. If you actually use the Double Cyclone against him, he'll send out several flying drones that can easily crowd the screen, thereby actually making this fight more difficult than it needs to be.

Strangely enough, the General is probably the easiest boss in the game next to Eregion. Then again, what this fight lacks in difficulty, it can easily make up for in tediousness. If you're unlucky, the General can sometimes get into an annoying loop of staying at one end of the room and spamming his "Nuclear SpaghettiOs" over and over again. Unless he decides to head over to whatever side of the wall you're camping on, this fight is probably going to take a while.
